details.chemicals_used: anhydrous LiI (99%, Acros Organics), 3-hydroxypropionitrile (HPN, 98%, Acros Organics), silica powder (micrometer SiO2 with particle diameter 0.3−2 μm, ultrafine, Tianjin Chemical Reagent Factory, China; nanometer SiO2, 15 nm, Degussa)
details.equipment: argon-filled glovebox (M.Braun), scanning electron microscope (SEM, Hitachi S-4000)
details.other_conditions: first heating the mixture until a homogeneous melt was obtained, then cooling to room temperature naturally; for electrolytes containing inert oxide additives, silica powder was added into the melts, followed by stirring and ultrasonicating vigorously until a homogeneous composite was formed

details.equipment: HP 4192A impedance analyzer, special design test cell with a sandwich structure of 'stainless steel/electrolyte/stainless steel'
details.other_conditions: electrolyte was melted in advance and filled between two electrode plates to improve the interfacial contact; the distance between two electrodes is fixed by a special design

details.equipment: Rigaku R-AXIS RAPID IP diffractometer (λ(Mo Kα) = 0.71073 Å)
details.other_conditions: single-crystal particle with dimension of 0.794 × 0.285 × 0.421 mm3 was selected; crystal was sealed in a capillary to protect from moisture

details.chemicals_used: TiO2 (P25) paste, conducting glass substrate (F-doped SnO2, 10 Ω /□), dye cis-dithiocyanate-N,N‘-bis(4,4‘-dicarboxylate-2,2‘-bipyridine)ruthenium(II) (RuN3, Solaronix) with a concentration of 3 × 10-4 M in dry ethanol
details.time: 30 min for sintering, overnight for dye immersion
details.other_conditions: mesoporous TiO2 film was preheated before immersion into dye solution

details.chemicals_used: composite electrolytes, solvents dimethyl carbonate (DMC) and propylene carbonate (PC) (Battery Grade, 4:1, v/v)
details.other_conditions: electrolyte solution was dropped onto the surface of the TiO2 film and solvents were removed under vacuum; procedure repeated several times until the TiO2 film was covered with the electrolyte; an open sandwich-type cell was fabricated in air by clamping the TiO2/electrolyte with a thermally platinized ITO counter electrode
